H0.text: Copper is the metal that will be attracted to a magnet.

H1.text: Gold is not attracted to a magnet, because gold is a non‑magnetic metal.

H2.text: Iron is a metal that will be attracted to a magnet.

H3.text: Silver is a metal that will be attracted to a magnet.

A4.text: Below its Curie point of 770 °C (1,420 °F; 1,040 K), α-iron changes from paramagnetic to ferromagnetic: the spins of the two unpaired electrons in each atom generally align with the spins of its neighbors, creating an overall magnetic field.
